text: "How Do I Get There" is a song written by Chris Farren, and co-written and recorded by American country music artist Deana Carter. It was released in 1996 as a 7" jukebox single along with the song "Did I Shave My Legs for This?", and in 1997 as a promotional CD single. The song became her third single to reach the top of the Billboard Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart. The song was Carter's last Number One hit on the country chart. == Track listing == == Chart performance == "How Do I Get There" debuted at number 52 on the U.S. Billboard Hot Country Singles & Tracks for the chart week of August 2, 1997. {|class="wikitable sortable" !align="left"|Chart (1997) !align="center"|Peak position |- |- |} ===Year-end charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !scope="col"|Chart (1997) !scope="col"|Position |- | Canada Country Tracks (RPM) | align="center" | 41 |- | US Country Songs (Billboard) | align="center" | 23 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Billboard Hot Country Songs number-one singles Category:Deana Carter songs Category:Songs written by Deana Carter Category:Songs written by Chris Farren (country musician) Category:Song recordings produced by Chris Farren (country musician) Category:1996 songs
title: How Do I Get There
